channel.title: [PI] How Can I make a wilderness Area a safezone? [PI]

item.title: [PI] How Can I make a wilderness Area a safezone? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

Unsure if this has been fixed so this code would work

   public boolean inWild() {
      if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 || absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366) {   
      return true;
   
      }
      if (absX >= 3294 && absX <= 3298 && absY >= 3648 && absY <= 3651) {   
      return true;
   
      }
      return false;
   }
}

Look added another True statement easy

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] How Can I make a wilderness Area a safezone? [PI]

item.title: [PI] How Can I make a wilderness Area a safezone? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“sly theft, post:10, topic:371231”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=467315.msg3418592#msg3418592 date=1291325413]

[code=Java] public boolean inWild() {
if((absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 || absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366) && absX >= 3294 && absX <= 3298 && absY >= 3648 && absY <= 3651) {
return true;

  }
  return false;

}[/code]
[/quote]

Umm Almost except you kinda turned the area where I wanted to be safe ( the box at hills ) into a wildy zone and the rest of the wildy into a safe zone XD[/quote]

Oh, well i misunderstood the coords for the safe zone,

Just reverse it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] How Can I make a wilderness Area a safezone? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sly_theft sly theft
item.description:
@sly_theft wrote:

[quote=“Ashton51, post:7, topic:371231”][quote author=sly theft link=topic=467315.msg3417455#msg3417455 date=1291233404]

Change your isInWild method to disclude the coordinates for the hills.

Thanks man
ok so when I get to isinwield what code what I use to Remove the hills Cordinates from inwild, Would you be able to make a copy and show me ? Please I dont have isinwild I just have inwild it looks like this

if(inWild()) {
int modY = absY > 6400 ? absY - 6400 : absY;
wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 4);
getPA().walkableInterface(197);
if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
if(inMulti()) {
getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: “+wildLevel, 199);
} else {
getPA().sendFrame126(”@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
}
[/quote]

That is what shows the interfaces if the player is in the wild and makes it so players can attack other players.

Go into Player.java

Find this

public boolean inWild() {

And paste that whole thing here.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] How Can I make a wilderness Area a safezone? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“sly theft, post:5, topic:371231”][quote author=Ashton51 link=topic=467315.msg3417153#msg3417153 date=1291187909]
Change your isInWild method to disclude the coordinates for the hills.
[/quote]

ok so when I get to isinwield what code what I use to Remove the hills Cordinates from inwild, Would you be able to make a copy and show me ? Please I dont have isinwild I just have inwild it looks like this

if(inWild()) {
int modY = absY > 6400 ? absY - 6400 : absY;
wildLevel = (((modY - 3520) / 8) + 4);
getPA().walkableInterface(197);
if(Config.SINGLE_AND_MULTI_ZONES) {
if(inMulti()) {
getPA().sendFrame126("@yel@Level: “+wildLevel, 199);
} else {
getPA().sendFrame126(”@yel@Level: "+wildLevel, 199);
}[/quote]

That is what shows the interfaces if the player is in the wild and makes it so players can attack other players.

Go into Player.java

Find this

public boolean inWild() {

And paste that whole thing here.
